newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - May 13.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - May 13.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Tuesday:
* On Monday, the Dow closed up 123.22 points, or 1.72 percent, at 7,292.75 as Wall Street bet that the Federal Reserve will keep interest rates unchanged at a policy-setting meeting next week.

* Indonesia's central bank governor Sudradjad Djiwandono told Reuters Financial Television in an interview on Monday that he was worried over the recent rise of the yen against the dollar as much of Indonesia's external debt was denominated in yen.
* On Monday, the Jakarta composite index rose 2.12 points to close at 675.81 points.
* On Tuesday, the rupiah was quoted at 2,428.00/28.50 at 0135 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,427.00/28.00.
* Polyester manufacturer Polysindo on reports of a $800 million expansion programme.
* Energy firm Medco on reports the firm's venture with Indonesian conglomerate Setdco had secured approval to buy a large stake in an oil firm in the central Asian nation of Kazakhstan.
* Summarecon on reports that the Capital Market Supervisory Agency (Bapepam) had asked the property firm for clarification over the firm's 1996 annual report.
* Retailer Hero on market talk that retailer Matahari was likely to acquire Hero.
* Automobile conglomerate Astra on reports the government was seeking additional loans to finance the national car programme.
* Selamat Sampurna on a Neraca newspapers report it had agreed to supply automotive parts to Bakrie Motor.
* Cocoa grinding firm Cahaya Kalbar on market talk of a possible rights issue to acquire a trading firm.
